title: Relates to aid and incentives for municipalities with populations of greater than two hundred thousand
summary: Relates to aid and incentives for municipalities with populations of greater than two hundred thousand.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          774

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. GANTT, MORELLE -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Ways and Means

       AN ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to aid and incentives
         for municipalities with populations of greater than two hundred  thou-
         sand

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph (vi) of  paragraph  e  of  subdivision  10  of
    2  section  54 of the state finance law, as amended by section 2 of part GG
    3  of chapter 56 of the laws of 2009, is relettered subparagraph (vii)  and
    4  amended and a new subparagraph (vi) is added to read as follows:
    5    (VI)  COMMENCING WITH THE STATE FISCAL YEAR COMMENCING ON APRIL FIRST,
    6  TWO THOUSAND ELEVEN AND THEREAFTER, ALL MUNICIPALITIES WITH A POPULATION
    7  OF GREATER THAN TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND SHALL RECEIVE EQUAL PER CAPITA  AID
    8  PROVIDED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  SUBDIVISION.    PER  CAPITA  AID  SHALL BE
    9  INCREASED FOR ALL MUNICIPALITIES WITH A POPULATION OF GREATER  THAN  TWO
   10  HUNDRED  THOUSAND  TO  THE HIGHEST PER CAPITA AID CALCULATED PURSUANT TO
   11  THIS SUBDIVISION FOR A MUNICIPALITY WITH A POPULATION GREATER  THAN  TWO
   12  HUNDRED THOUSAND.
   13    (vii)  If sufficient funds are not available for additional aid in the
   14  amount authorized pursuant to subparagraphs (ii), (iii), (iv) [and], (v)
   15  AND (VI) of this paragraph, additional aid shall be apportioned to  each
   16  municipality  eligible for such aid based on the municipality's pro rata
   17  share of available funds.
   18    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03394-01-1
